preflabel: protocol of Rasmussen et al. (2006)
definition: Protocol described in Rasmussen, S.O. et al. (2006), A new Greenland ice core chronology for the last glacial termination. Journal of Geophysical Research, 111, D06102.

preflabel: computation of Blundell and Barber (2005)
definition: Computation described in Blundell and K. Barber (2005), A 2800-year palaeoclimatic record from Tore Hill Moss, Strathspey, Scotland: the need for a multi-proxy approach to peat-based climate reconstructions, Quaternary Science Reviews 24, pp.1261-1277.

preflabel: not specified
definition: There is no information available on the post-analysis data-processing protocol used to obtain the observable property measurement.

preflabel: lipid normalisation (wet weight cct/lipid proportion)
definition: The wet weight concentration is divided by the proportion of lipids in the sample

preflabel: lipid normalisation (wet weight cct/lipid proportion) and weaning correction
definition: The wet weight concentration is divided by the proportion of lipids in the sample and value obtained is adjusted for samples taken from weaned pups.

preflabel: corrected for the detrital contribution
decay correction to sampling time
concentration to activity conversion based on half life
computation
definition: The result has been produced using a mathematical calculation that should be described in the usage metadata.

preflabel: calibration against sample data
definition: The sensor has been calibrated against discrete measurements of the observed property.

preflabel: corrected for the dissolution of lithogenic minerals
processed following the protocol of Yentsch+Menzel
definition: Protocol described in Yentsch, C.S. and Menzel, D.W. (1963), A method for determination of phytoplankton chlorophyll and phaeophytin by fluorescence. Deep-Sea Research, 10, 221-231.

preflabel: no calibration against sample data
definition: The sensor has not been calibrated against discrete measurements of the observed property.

preflabel: calibration against Ca analyses with correction for chlorophyll interference
definition: Calibration of green-light transmissometer against Ca analyses with chl interference correction.

preflabel: laboratory calibration applied
definition: The sensor has been calibrated using a calibration determined on the sensor in the laboratory.

preflabel: summation of size-fractionated values
definition: Sum of measurements made on each filter in a filter cascade.

preflabel: computation from the ratio of upwelled irradiance at 490 and 570 nm
definition: Computed from the ratio of upwelled irradiance at 490 and 570 nm.

preflabel: profile integration
definition: Integration of a series of values of an observed property from the surface to the integration depth (specified elsewhere), usually to provide a measurement per unit area.

preflabel: manufacturer's calibration applied
definition: The sensor has been calibrated using the manufacturer's calibration.

preflabel: algal1 algorithm
definition: Calibration algorithm used to generate chlorophyll concentrations from MERIS multiple-waveband normalised water-leaving radiance measurements.

preflabel: correction for nitrite
definition: Measurement of nitrate+nitrite corrected to remove the nitrite component.

preflabel: calibration against independent measurements
definition: The sensor has been calibrated against other measurements of the observed property (e.g. from another sensor).

preflabel: derivation from the raw data from the dark chamber with calibration against sample data
definition: Bench FRRF measurement with a sample calibration applied.

preflabel: computation from the ratio of upwelled irradiance at 440 and 570 nm
definition: Computed from the ratio of upwelled irradiance at 440 and 570 nm.

preflabel: differencing the results from 0.4um and 10**4 Dalton filtered water
definition: The results of analyses of samples filtered through 0.4um and a 10000 Dalton (a Dalton is a unit of atomic mass) filters have been differenced to give the data presented.

preflabel: processing following the Lorenzen protocol
definition: Protocol described in Lorenzen, C.J. (1967), Determination of chlorophyll and pheo-pigments: spectrophotometric equations. Limnology and Oceanography, 12(2), 343-346.

preflabel: OC5 algorithm
definition: Calibration algorithm used to generate chlorophyll concentrations from remotely sensed multiple-waveband normalised water-leaving radiance measurements.

preflabel: synthesis from multiple satellite sensors
definition: Synthesis of calibrated data from multiple sensors on one or more satellite platforms.

preflabel: summation of size-fractionated values and profile integration
definition: Integration of a series of summed of measurements made on each filter in a filter cascade different depths from the surface to the integration depth (specified elsewhere), usually to provide a measurement per unit area.

preflabel: normalisation to organic carbon and lutum content (RIKZ 'standard sediment')
definition: A trace chemical analysis method where the recorded value is normalised to the Dutch Rijkswaterstaat standard sediment having 10% organic matter, or equivalently 5% organic carbon.

preflabel: subtraction of nominal ambient pressure value
definition: The data presented represent those recorded by the instrument minus a nominal ambient pressure.

preflabel: differencing determinations on sample before and after 400C ignition
definition: The difference in elemental concentrations has been taken before and after the sampel was subjected to ignition at 400C.

preflabel: differencing DMSO before and after incubation
definition: A change in the concentration of dimethylsulphoxide (DMSO) has been calculated by taking the difference of the DMSO concentrations before and after an incubation experiment.

preflabel: differencing DOC before and after incubation
definition: A change in the concentration of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) has been calculated by taking the difference of the DOC concentrations before and after an incubation experiment.

preflabel: differencing of the measurements
definition: The measurements of a 'before and after' experiment have been differenced.

preflabel: differencing results from acidified and unacidified samples
definition: The data presented are the result of differencing the outcomes of both acidified and unacidified experiments.

preflabel: differencing results from acidified and unacidified samples and profile integration
definition: The data presented are the result of differencing the outcomes of both acidified and unacidified experiments and integration of a profile of measurements.

preflabel: differencing results from acidified and unacidified samples, summation of size fractionated data and profile integration
definition: The data presented are the result of differencing the outcomes of both acidified and unacidified experiments, the integration of data from the complete size range and the integration of data through a vertical profile.

preflabel: division of in-situ resistivity by resistivity of overlying water
definition: The data presented are the resutl of the division of the resistivity of the in-situ pore water by the resisitvity of the overlying water.

preflabel: division of upwelling irradiance by downwelling irradiance
definition: The data presented are the result of dividing the measured upwelling irradiance by the measured downwelling irradiance.

preflabel: empirical correction for optics fouling and Saunders compressibility correction
definition: An attenuance data proccessing method which involves an empirical correction for fouling of the optical instrument window and the Saunders correction for the compressibility of water, described in Saunders (1981). Practical conversion of pressure to depth. J. Phys. Oceanogr. 11: 373-4.

preflabel: estimation from phytoplankton spectral absorption coefficients after Dubinsky (1980)
definition: A light absorbance data processing protocol defined in Dubinsky (1980). Light utilization efficiency in natural phytoplankton communities. In: Primary Productivity in the Sea". Plenum pp. 83-97."

preflabel: estimation from surface roughness
definition: The parameter is an estimate based on observation of the roughness of the sea surface.

preflabel: expressed as PPi
definition: The data presented are expressed as the reagent in the process, PPi.

preflabel: expressed to unspecified datum by subtraction of a constant
definition: The data presented have been corrected to an unspecified datum by the subtraction of a constant from the recorded measurement.

preflabel: Fourier analysis after Goda (1970)
definition: A wave data processing protocol specified in Goda, Y. (1970) Proc. JSCE, 180 (in Japanese).

preflabel: Fourier analysis after Nolte and Hsu (1972)
definition: A wave data processing protocol specified in Nolte K G,Hsu F H.Statistics of ocean wave groups[C].Dallas,Texas:Fourth Annual Offshore Technology Conf,1972:637-644.

preflabel: Fourier analysis with NO depth attenuation correction
definition: A wave data processing protocol which does not take into account corrections associated with the attenuation of wave energy with depth.

preflabel: geometric statistics computation
definition: The parameter has been calculated from the computation of statistics describing the geometry of the sediment sample.

preflabel: laboratory calibration against formazin
definition: A procedure where a nephelometer is calibrated on standard nominal turbidity scale based on mesurements made in different concentrations of formazin. Formazin is a particulate phase with 1.5 micron median particle size (0.6 micron standard deviation).

preflabel: manual record analysis
definition: Derived statistics have been obtained by manual analysis of data recorded on hard-copy paper charts.

preflabel: most probable number analysis
definition: Statistical estimation of an abundance from a number of replicate determinations.

preflabel: multiplication by 10**7
definition: The data value has been scaled by the stated factor, generally to facilitate precision preservation by storing as an integer.

preflabel: NO correction or calibration of raw count rates
definition: The data value has not been converted from from the raw number of counts made by the instrument.

preflabel: NO salt correction
definition: Whilst the data value has been converted into engineering units it has not been corrected for the presence of sea salt in the sample.

preflabel: NO verification against independent measurements
definition: Whilst the data value has been converted into engineering units it has not been verified or back-calibrated against co-located, generally high accuracy, measurements using a different technique such as Winkler titration for oxygen or bench salinometer for salinity.

preflabel: computation of carbon biomass from abundance
definition: Carbon biomass has been computed from the number of individuals and the conversion factor is either unknown or specified elsewhere.

preflabel: computation of carbon produced from amino acid uptake, abundance and cell volume data
definition: Carbon production rate has been computed from the number of individuals and a proxy for biomass production rate.

preflabel: computation from air temperature and relative humidity data
definition: The data have been calculated from the corresponding air temperature and relative humidity values.

preflabel: computation from concentration
definition: The parameter has been calculated from a measured concentration and physical parameters such as temperature and salinity.

preflabel: computation of carbon biomass from abundance using the equation of Putt and Stoecker (1989)
definition: Carbon biomass has been computed from the number of individuals using the protocol documented in Putt M, Stoeker DK (1989) An experimentally determined carbon:volume ratio for marine 'oligotrichous' ciliates from estuarine and coastal waters. Limnol Ocean 34:1097-1103.

preflabel: analysis of cumulative frequency ordered by phi (coarse to fine)
definition: A method of determining the distribution of grain sizes in a sample which involves determining grain size on the logarithmic phi scale described in Krumbein and Sloss (1963) Stratigraphy and Sedimentation, 2nd edition; Freeman; San Francisco.

preflabel: analysis of cumulative settling rate curve
definition: A method of determining the distribution of grain sizes by ordering the settling rates of the particles within a sample.

preflabel: analysis of cumulative settling rate curve after Folk and Ward (1957)
definition: A method of determining the distribution of grain sizes by ordering the settling rates of the particles within a sample described in Folk, R.L., and Ward, W.C., 1957, Brazos River Bar: A study in the significance of grain size parameters: Journal of Sedimentary Petrology, v. 27, no. 1, p. 3-26.

preflabel: automated record analysis
definition: A wave data processing protocol which automatically applies processing protocols to the raw data.

preflabel: averaging of all functional beams
definition: The data value was produced by taking the simple arithmetic average of values from all functioning replicate sensors on an instrument.

preflabel: averaging values from multiple core segments
definition: The data value presented has been calculated as the average value of measurements from multiple segments within a core.

preflabel: computation of carbon biomass from measured weight and profile integration
definition: Biomass was measured per unit volume, converted from mass to carbon and the value per unit area was determined by depth integration.

preflabel: computation from 1st order Fourier coefficients of directional distribution of energy, A1 and B1
computation from DMS concentration and shipboard wind speed
definition: Flux calculation was based on measured DMS and the best available windspeed from the ship's anemometer.

preflabel: computation from Fm and Fo fluorescence yields from the dark chamber
definition: The data value presented has been calculated from the maximum and minimum chlorophyll-a fluorescence yields measured in a dark-adapted state.

preflabel: computation from Fm and Fo fluorescence yields from the light chamber
definition: The data value presented has been calculated from the maximum and minimum chlorophyll-a fluorescence yields measured in a light-adapted state.

preflabel: computation from potassium concentration
definition: The beta activity has been determined by measuring the amount of potassium in the sample and using natural isotopic composition data to convert this to the amount of radioactive 40K isotope.

preflabel: computation from rate of change of concentration in overlying water
definition: The rate of exchange of material between water and sediment has been determined by monitoring the concentration changes in the water and converting this to quantity of material passing between the phases per unit area per unit time.

preflabel: computation of carbon from calcium
definition: The amount of calcium in the sample was measured and converted to carbon on the basis of CaCO3 composition (one mole of carbon for each mole of calcium).

preflabel: calibration against sample data and computation from concentration using Benson and Krause algorithm
definition: Oxygen concentration was determined by an instrumental measurement calibrated against chemical (generally Winkler Titration) measurements on co-located water samples and saturation was computed according to Benson, B.B., and Krause, D., Jr. 1984. The concentration and isotopic fractionation of oxygen dissolved in freshwater and seawater in equilibrium with the atmosphere. Limnology and Oceanography, 29: 620-632.

preflabel: calibration to read zero in clear water
definition: A correction has been made to the data for light source deterioration using a procedure that results in a zero value in pure water, rather than a zero value in air (which would give a value in pure water of around 0.36).

preflabel: calibration using protocols of Deines (1999)
definition: An acoustic backscatter calibration protocol described in Deines, K. L. (1999). Backscatter Estimation Using Broadband Acoustic Doppler Current Profilers. In: Anderson, S. P.,Terry, E. A., White, J. A. R., & William, A. J., (Editors), Proceedings of IEEE 6th Working Conference on Current Measurement Technology, pp. 249-253.

preflabel: computation after Folk and Ward (1957)
definition: The value is a statistic derived from sediment grain size distribution data using the equations published in Folk, R.L., and Ward, W.C. (1957). Brazos River bar, a study in the significance of grain-size parameters. J. Sediment. Petrol. 27:3-26.

preflabel: computation from concentration using Benson and Krause algorithm
definition: Saturation was computed from actual concentration and a theoretical concentration predicted from temperature and salinity using the algorithm of Benson, B.B., and Krause, D., Jr. (1984). The concentration and isotopic fractionation of oxygen dissolved in freshwater and seawater in equilibrium with the atmosphere. Limnology and Oceanography, 29: 620-632.

preflabel: computation from concentration using Weiss algorithm
definition: Saturation was computed from actual concentration and theoretical concentrationpredicted from temperature and salinity using the algorithm of Weiss, RF. (1970). The solubility of nitrogen, oxygen and argon in water and seawater. Deep-Sea Research. 17:721-735.

preflabel: computation from cross spectra
definition: The data have been calculated from a cross spectra analysis: a mathematical covariance function used to identify time-series variations with similar spectral properties, i.e. high power in the same spectral frequency bands.

preflabel: computation from CTD density profile
definition: The value was derived by determination from a CTD profile of the depth at which the density increased from surface density by the amount given in the parameter definition.

preflabel: computation from CTD temperature profile
definition: The value was derived by determination from a CTD profile of the depth at which the temperature decreased from surface temperature by the amount given in the parameter definition.

preflabel: computation from fast microstructure temperature
definition: The parameter has been calculated from the output of a thermistor probe which is capable of resolving high resolution temperature differences in a very small time period.

preflabel: computation from horizontal co-spectra translation after Kuik et al. (1988)
definition: A wave data processing protocol developed from the work of Kuik, Van Vledder and Holthuijsen (1988). A method for the routine analysis of pitch-and-roll buoy wave data. J. Phys. Oceanogr. 18: 1020-1034.

preflabel: computation from moments as defined by Cartwright and Longuet-Higgins (1956)
definition: A wave data processing method described in Cartwright and Longuet-Higgins (1956). The statistical distribution of the maxima of a random function. Proc. Roy Soc. A 237:212-232.

preflabel: computation from pH and alkalinity
definition: The parameter has been calculated from the corresponding pH and alkalinity values.

preflabel: computation from phi size distribution
definition: The parameter has been calculated from the distribution of grain sizes within the sample as represented on the logarithmic phi scale described in Krumbein & Sloss (1963) Stratigraphy and Sedimentation, 2nd edition; Freeman; San Francisco.

preflabel: computation from pressure, salinity and IPTS-68 temperature using UNESCO algorithm
definition: The parameter has been calculated from the corresponding pressure, salinity and temperature (on the IPTS-68 scale) values using the algorithm in Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: computation from probe free-fall time using unspecified algorithm
definition: The distance travelled (i.e. the depth of the probe below the surface) was computed from time using an unknown assumed speed and/or acceleration.

preflabel: computation from PvI data and measured light profile
definition: The data value has been computed from parameters derived from photosynthesis-versus-light curve analyses and the observed in-situ light profile.

preflabel: computation from PvI data and measured wavelength-dependent phytoplankton absorption coefficients
definition: The data value has been computed from parameters derived from photosynthesis-versus-light curve analyses and the observed wavelength-dependent absorption coefficients.

preflabel: computation from salinity and potential temperature using UNESCO algorithm
definition: The parameter has been calculated from the corresponding salinity and potential temperature values using the algorithm in Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: computation from salinity and temperature using UNESCO algorithm
definition: The parameter has been calculated from the corresponding salinity and temperature values using the algorithm in Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: computation from temperature and salinity by unspecified algorithm
definition: The parameter has been calculated from the corresponding salinity and temperature values using an unspecified algorithm.

preflabel: computation from the ratio of horizontal translation to heave
definition: A wave data processing protocol which involves analysis of the ratio of the horizontal and vertical movements of the gauge.

preflabel: computation from travel time averaged from all operational beams and unknown sound velocity profile
definition: The parameter has been derived from the average of the two-way travel time of all operational acoustic beams on the instrument and using an unspecified sound velocity profile within the water column.

preflabel: computation from turbulent kinetic energy and density
definition: A vertical diffusion coefficient data processing protocol which involves computing the parameter from the corresponding values of turbulent kinetic energy and density.

preflabel: computation from variation of light intensity with depth
definition: A light extinction coefficient data processing protocol using computation from the light intensity profile.

preflabel: computation from volume scatter data
definition: An optical backscatter data processing protocol where the scattering of light within a volume is used to calculate the values.

preflabel: correction using co-located air pressure data expressed to unspecified datum by subtraction of a constant
definition: A seawater pressure data processing protocol which corrects the recorded data for the atmospheric pressure signal from a co-located atmospheric pressure sensor and translates the data to an unspecified datum through the subtraction of a constant.

preflabel: correction after Del Grosso
definition: A correction to the recorded data for the speed of sound in water described in Del Grosso (1974). 'New equation for the speed of sound in natural waters (with comparisons to other equations). J. Acoust. Soc. Am. 56: 1084-1091

preflabel: computation from wet and dry bulb thermometer data
definition: Standard meteorological calculation to determine humidity from the degree of cooling produced by evaporation of water.

preflabel: computation of density reciprocal from pressure, temperature and salinity
definition: A factor for the conversion of per volume data to per mass data corresponding to the reciprocal of density as calculated from the corresponding pressure, temperature and salinity measurements.

preflabel: computation of depth using unspecified drop rate algorithm converted to pressure using UNESCO algorithm
definition: An expendable bathythermograph (XBT) data processing protocol which converts the depths recorded using an unspecified drop rate to pressure using the appropriate algorithm from Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: computation of rate of change from variable incubation durations
definition: A technique for calculating the partition coefficient of trace metals in the water column which uses incubation experiments of differing lengths.

preflabel: computation using P-EXEC algorithm
definition: A data processing algorithm contained within the Pstar software suite.

preflabel: computation using stereometrical configurations of Edler (1979)
definition: Abundance to biovolume conversion following the protocol described in Edler L (ed) (1979) Recommendations for marine biological studies in the Baltic Sea—phytoplankton and chlorophyll. The Baltic Marine Biologists Publ 5:1-38.

preflabel: computation using stereometrical configurations of Edler(1979) and carbon factor of Gonzalez and Smetacek(1994)
definition: Abundance to biovolume conversion following the protocol described in Edler L (ed) (1979) Recommendations for marine biological studies in the Baltic Sea—phytoplankton and chlorophyll. The Baltic Marine Biologists Publ 5:1-38. Biovolume to carbon biomass using the carbon conversion factor of Gonzalez, H.E., Smetacek, V., (1994). The possible role of the cyclopoid copepod Oithona in retarding vertical flux of zooplankton fecal material. Mar. Ecol.Prog. Ser. 113, 233-246.

preflabel: computation using UNESCO algorithm
definition: The parameter has been calculated using the appropriate algorithm from Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: computation using UNESCO algorithm and calibration against independent measurements
definition: The parameter has been calculated with calibration against an independently measured sample and using the appropriate algorithm from Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: computation using UNESCO algorithm and NO calibration against independent measurements
definition: The parameter has been calculated without calibration against an independently measured sample and using the appropriate algorithm from Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: conversion to Beaufort scale
definition: Classification of windspeed into twelve classes with standardised boundaries.

preflabel: conversion to depth using unspecified algorithm
definition: The parameter has been converted to depth using an unknown algorithm.

preflabel: conversion to WMO code
definition: Classification into classes with standardised boundaries specified in an unspecified World Meteorological Organisation published table .

preflabel: conversion to WMO code using table 0885/0877
definition: Classification into classes with standardised boundaries specified in World Meteorological Organisation published tables 0885 and 0877 .

preflabel: conversion to WMO code using table 1555
definition: Classification into classes with standardised boundaries specified in World Meteorological Organisation published table 1555 .

preflabel: conversion to WMO code using table 3155
definition: Classification into classes with standardised boundaries specified in World Meteorological Organisation published table 315 .

preflabel: conversion to WMO code using table 3700
definition: Classification into classes with standardised boundaries specified in World Meteorological Organisation published table 3700 .

preflabel: conversion to WMO code using table 4677/4501
definition: Classification into classes with standardised boundaries specified in World Meteorological Organisation published tables 4677 and 4501.

preflabel: conversion to seawater depth using UNESCO algorithm
definition: The parameter has been converted to seawater depth using the appropriate algorithm from Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: correction for atmospheric pressure
definition: A seawater pressure data processing protocol which removes the atmospheric pressure signal from the recorded data.

preflabel: correction to read zero at sea level
definition: The data presented have been corrected to be zero at the corresponding sea level.

preflabel: correction after Kuwahara
definition: A correction to the recorded data for the speed of sound in water described in Kuwahara & Poeckert (1989). Accurate seafloor mapping using precise navigation and side-scan sonar. Oceans '89: The Global Ocean, 4: 1148-1152

preflabel: correction after Wilson
definition: A correction to the recorded data for the speed of sound in water described in Wilson (1960). Equation for the speed of sound in sea water. J. Acoust. Soc. Amer. 32(10): 1357

preflabel: correction based on measured sound velocity profile
definition: A correction to the recorded data for the speed of sound in water based on the observed profile of sound velocity in the water column.

preflabel: correction for bacterial chlorophyll c+d following Caraco & Puccoon 1986 and Golterman et al. 1978 protocols
definition: A correction for the presence of bacterial chlorophyll-c and -d was applied to the recorded data as detailed in Caraco & Puccoon (1986). The measurement of bacterial chlorophyll and algal chlorophyll a in natural waters. Limnol. Oceanogr. 31(4): 889-893; Golterman, Clymo & Ohnstad MAM (1978). Methods of physical and chemical analysis of fresh water. Blackwell Scientific Publishers, Oxford, 214p.

preflabel: correction for drift
definition: The data value has been corrected for instrument drift.

preflabel: correction for hydrolysis
definition: The data value has been corrected for the chemical process of hydrolysis (the splitting of a water molecule into H+ and OH-).

preflabel: correction for seawater compressibility
definition: The data value has been corrected for the compressibility of seawater at depth.

preflabel: correction to a common scale
definition: The data were recorded on an arbitrary scale and have been translated to a common scale throughout the record.

preflabel: correction to a path length of 1m
definition: The data were recorded on one path length and have been corrected to a one metre path length.

preflabel: correction to a path length of 1m and for seawater compressibility
definition: The data were recorded on one path length and have been corrected to a one metre path length and for the compressibility of seawater at depth.

preflabel: correction to sea level
definition: The data measured have been corrected to sea level by addition of a constant.

preflabel: correction to sea level and averaging of multiple sensors
definition: The data measured have been corrected to sea level by addition of a constant and have been averaged from the output of multiple instruments.

preflabel: correction to sea level and subtraction of value predicted by tidal analysis
definition: A residual value of pressure has been computed by calibrating the instrument to read zero at sea level and subtracting values computed using an unspecified tidal analysis algorithm from the measured values.

preflabel: correction to true North
definition: The data value was measured relative to magnetic North then corrected to true North by adding the magnetic declination for the location and time of the measurement.

preflabel: correction to zero at sea level and conversion to depth using unspecified algorithm
definition: The recorded data have been corrected to read zero at sea level and have been converted to depth using an unspecified algorithm.

preflabel: correction using Carter's tables
definition: An echo sounder data correction specified in Carter (1980). Echo-Sounding Correction Tables, 3rd Edition. Hydrographic Department, Taunton, UK.

preflabel: correction using co-located air pressure and subtraction of value predicted by tidal analysis
definition: A residual value of pressure has been computed by subtracting measured atmospheric pressures followed by values computed using an unspecified tidal analysis algorithm from the measured values.

preflabel: correction using Matthew's tables
definition: An echo sounder data correction specified in Matthews (1939). Tables of the Velocity of Sound in Pure Water and Sea Water for Use in Echo-Sounding and Sound- Ranging, 2nd Ed. Hydrographic Department, Ministry of Defense, United Kingdom.

preflabel: dark current baseline correction
definition: The instrument output has been corrected for the baseline measurement made by the instrument in the dark.

preflabel: derivation from GEBCO centenary edition 1-minute global grid
definition: The data have been derived from the GEBCO Centenary Edition CD-ROM data, one-minute grid.

preflabel: derivation from the raw data from the dark chamber to Kolber et al 1998 biophysical model using Laney v4 2003 software
definition: The data value has been derived from the dark chamber instrument output and software which implements the biophysical model of Kolber, Prasil & Falkowski (1998). Measurements of variable chlorophyll fluorescence using fast repetition rate techniques. I. Defining methodology and experimental protocols. Biochem. Biophys. Acta 1367: 88-106.

preflabel: derivation from the raw data from the light chamber to Kolber et al 1998 biophysical model using Laney v4 2003 software
definition: The data value has been derived from the light chamber instrument output and software which implements the biophysical model of Kolber, Prasil & Falkowski (1998). Measurements of variable chlorophyll fluorescence using fast repetition rate techniques. I. Defining methodology and experimental protocols. Biochem. Biophys. Acta 1367: 88-106.

preflabel: differencing carbon uptake with and without nitrification inhibitor
definition: An oxidation rate has been calculated by taking the difference of the carbon uptake in incubation experiments conducted with and without nitrification inhibitors present.

preflabel: volume computation from mass and mean density
definition: A sediment pore water data processing protocol which involves taking the mass of the sample before and after drying and takes into account the mean density of the sediment.

preflabel: volume computation from weight loss on drying and salt correction
definition: A sediment pore water data processing protocol which involves taking the mass of the sample before and after drying and takes into account the salinity of the water driven off from the sample during drying.

preflabel: normalisation with biomass expressed as carbon
definition: The data presented have been normalised such that the biomass fraction of the sample defined by the parameter is expressed as carbon.

preflabel: normalisation with biomass expressed as nitrogen
definition: The data presented have been normalised such that the biomass fraction of the sample defined by the parameter is expressed as nitrogen.

preflabel: processing following SCOR protocol
definition: A pigment concentration data protocol defined in Jeffrey SW, Humphrey SF (1975) New spectrophotometric equations for determining chlorophylls a, b, c1 and c2 in higher plants, algae and phytoplankton. Biochem. Biophysiol. Planzen, 167, 191-194.

preflabel: processing after Wright and Coffin (1984)
definition: A technique for calculating grazing turnover of bacteria described in Wright, R.T. and R.B. Coffin. 1984. Measurements of bacterial production and microzooplankton in an estuarine-coastal water system of northern Massachusetts. Microbial Ecology 10: 137-149.

preflabel: recomputation to potential temperature using pCO2*EXP((Theta - T)*0.0423)
definition: A partial pressure of CO2 data proccessing method where the data are recalculated to a potential temperature scale using the equation pCO2new = pCO2old * EXP((potential temperature - temperature) * 0.0423)

preflabel: recomputation to water location at fixed time using POL NSP model
definition: A positional data processing method which recomputes the position a sample was taken at to the water location at a fixed time as outlined in Jones (1991). A general purpose model for the North Sea project. NERC News 16: 25-26.

preflabel: salt correction
definition: A sediment density data processing protocol in which the mass of the dried sample has been corrected for the presence of salt from the water driven off during srying

preflabel: smoothed
definition: The irradiance field is smoothed as it is defined by an integral smoothing function.

preflabel: standardisation to NBS scale
definition: The measurements have been standardised to the appropriate scale defined by the United States National Institute of Standards and Technology (formerly the National Standards Bureau).

preflabel: correction after Stuiver and Reimer
definition: A correction applied to radiocarbon dates for variation in marine carbon reservoir.

preflabel: subtraction of measured atmospheric pressure and conversion to depth using unspecified algorithm
definition: A depth data processing protocol in which the the recorded pressure at depth is corrected for atmospheric pressure and the resulting value is converted to depth using an unknown algorithm.

preflabel: subtraction of Synechococcus+Prochlorococcus from total bacteria
definition: Simple differencing to determine heterotrophic bacteria abundance from determinations of total bacteria and of Synechococcus+Prochlorococcus.

preflabel: subtraction of tidal height sensor2 value from tidal height sensor1 value
definition: The value has been obtained by differencing simulataneous measurements from duplicate sensors.

preflabel: subtraction of value predicted by tidal analysis
definition: A residual value of pressure, sea level or current vectors has been computed by subtracting values computed using an unspecified tidal analysis algorithm from the measured values.

preflabel: summation of staged leachate analyses
definition: The overall concentration has been determined by adding together concentrations of the analyte in different chemical states as determined following a sequential leaching protocol. This record was initially set up for the protocols described in Chester et al 1988 (https://doi.org/10.1016/0304-4203(88)90036-9). This reference was removed on 05/08/2019 making this data processing record applicable to any sequential leaching protocols.

preflabel: summation of size-fractions and differencing results from acidified and unacidified samples
definition: The data presented are the result of differencing the outcomes of both acidified and unacidified experiments and the integration of data from the complete size range.

preflabel: summation of vehicle depth below water column surface and height above bed
definition: Water column depth has been determined by adding together measurements of distance to bed and distance to surface taken by an underwater vehicle.

preflabel: correction to in-situ temperature after Takahashi
definition: A partial pressure of CO2 data processing protocol specified in Takahashi et al (1993) Seasonal variation of CO2 and nutrients in the high-latitude surface oceans: A comparative study. Global Biogeochemical Cycles, 7, 843-878.

preflabel: taking the average value from two or more sensors
definition: The data value has been derived by averaging the simultaneous values recorded by multiple sensors.

preflabel: taking the maximum value from two or more sensors
definition: The data value has been derived by taking the highest simultaneous value recorded by multiple sensors. Generally used for shipborne radiometer data to minimise artefacts caused by shading.

preflabel: tidal analysis
definition: An unspecified protocol has been used to determine tidal harmonic constants from the measured time series and these constants have been used to compute the proportion of the measured value due to tides.

preflabel: transformation from WGS84 to Irish National Grid Reference System
definition: A geometric transformation has been applied to convert positions from a 3D geographic CRS to a national standard projection.

preflabel: unspecified prediction algorithm
definition: An unspecified computational prediction protocol has been used to derive the data values based on a theoretical model.

preflabel: verification against independent measurements
definition: The values have been checked and if necessary adjusted using data collected by another instrument measuring the parameter of interest adjacent to the instrument whilst it was making its measurements. Examples are verification of CTD temperatures using rev

preflabel: computation from wet bulk density and assumed mineral grain and seawater densities
computation from wet bulk density
correction for lithogenic Ba contribution
computation from pCO2 following correction to dry air and calibration against standards
Takahashi correction to in-situ temperature
definition: A partial pressure of CO2 data processing protocol specified in Takahashi et al (1993) Seasonal variation of CO2 and nutrients in the high-latitude surface oceans: A comparative study. Global Biogeochemical Cycles, 7, 843-878.

preflabel: computation from biovolume using equations from Menden-Deuer and Lessard (2000)
definition: Conversion from biovolume were made using the relationships derived by Menden-Deuer, S. and E. J. Lessard (2000). Carbon to volume relationships for dinoflagellates, diatoms, and other protist plankton. Limnology and Oceanography 45(3): 569-579.

preflabel: normalisation from per cell to per cell volume
definition: The measured value was divided by the biovolume.

preflabel: computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm
definition: The parameter has been calculated using the appropriate algorithm from Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris.

preflabel: computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm and NO calibration against independent measurements
definition: The parameter has been calculated using the algorithm from Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris; the sensor values have not been checked against in-situ measurements.

preflabel: computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm and calibration against independent measurements
definition: The parameter has been calculated using the algorithm from Fofonoff and Millard (1983). Algorithms for computation of fundamental properties of seawater. UNESCO, Paris; the sensor values have been calibrated against in-situ measurements.

preflabel: computation using Andrassy (1956) formula
definition: A method to calculate the body mass of nematodes using the formula W = (L*D2)/(1.6*106) where W is the mass (as fresh weight in micrograms) per individual, L is the nematode length (in microns) and D is the greatest body diameter (in microns). Andrassy I (1956) The determination of volume and weight of nematodes. Acta Zool 2:1–15.

preflabel: computation by morphometric method
definition: The variable (e.g. body mass) has been derived from formula based on the geometry and size measurement of the observed entity or component part thereof.

preflabel: categorisation using EMODnet chemistry reporting protocol
definition: The parameter is constrained according to the EMODnet chemistry reporting protocol.

preflabel: down-crossing analysis
definition: Refers to wave analysis performed on the section of the record where the waveform crosses the zero axis formed by the record average level from positive to negative.

preflabel: up-crossing analysis
definition: Refers to wave analysis performed on the section of the record where the waveform crosses the zero axis formed by the record average level from negative to positive.

preflabel: correction for variation in surface illumination
definition: A correction applied to underwater light measurements to account for changes in the light field at the surface of the water column.

preflabel: computation using stereometric formulas
definition: Calculation of the volume of an object using shape geometry, measurements and mathematical formula.

preflabel: expressed at measurement altitude
definition: Used for meteorological measurements made at a height that significantly differs from the accepted standard height of 10 metres above ground or sea level. A corrected value to a height of 10 metres is likely to be available as part of the dataset.

preflabel: correction for atmospheric stability and to a height of 10m
definition: TBC

preflabel: cell averaging
definition: A radar data processing method.

preflabel: classification to a term from the NVS SeaDataCloud Flow Cytometry Standardised Cluster Names Vocabulary (SDN:F02::)
definition: The observation has been identified using a term defined in the NVS SeaDataCloud Flow Cytometry Standardised Cluster Names F02 controlled vocabulary.

preflabel: computation from PvI and the absorption of photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) data
definition: The data value has been computed from parameters derived from photosynthesis-versus-light curve analyses and the observed absorption of photosynthetically active radiation (PAR).

preflabel: classification to a term from the JNCC's Marine Habitat Classification for Britain and Ireland Version 04.05 (SDN:M20::)
definition: The habitat has been described using a term define in the Joint Nature Conservation Committee's Marine Habitat Classification for Britain and Ireland Version version 04.05 (SDN:M20::).

preflabel: classification to a term from the JNCC's Marine Habitat Classification for Britain and Ireland Version 15.03 (SDN:M21::)
definition: The habitat has been described using a term define in the Joint Nature Conservation Committee's Marine Habitat Classification for Britain and Ireland Version version 15.03 (SDN:M21::).

preflabel: automated record analysis using the zero-crossing method
definition: An automated wave data processing protocol based on the zero-crossing method.

preflabel: Tucker-Draper method
definition: A method for analysing ocean wave records and reporting results (Draper L (1963) Proc. Inst. Civil Eng. 26 291-304).

preflabel: computation using protocol of Barstow et al. (1991)
definition: The parameter has been computed according to the protocol published in Barstow SF, Ueland G, Krogstad HE, Fossum BA 1991. The Wavescan second generation directional wave buoy. IEEE J OCEANIC ENG 16(2) 254-266.

preflabel: using the epsilon notation
definition: The isotope composition is reported using the epsilon notation for stable isotope fractionation defined as the deviation of the isotope ratio of a sample relative to a standardin parts per ten thousand (((Rsample - Rstandard)/Rstandard)x10000).

preflabel: using the delta notation
definition: The isotope composition is reported using the delta notation for stable isotope fractionation defined as the deviation of the isotope ratio of a sample relative to a standardin parts per thousand (((Rsample - Rstandard)/Rstandard)x1000).

preflabel: conversion from height above seabed using bathymetric depth
definition: The depth below sea surface was obtained by subtracting height above the bed from the bathymetric depth.

preflabel: computation from regression line of suspended sediment concentration versus water flow velocity
definition: The parameter has been determined from a linear regression of suspended sediment concentration versus shear current velocity.

preflabel: computation from total mass of suspended solids and bulk density
definition: The parameter has been derived by calculation of the sediment bulk density and the mass of suspended material removed.

preflabel: using 0 or 1 binary classification
definition: The value of a boolean data type is represented using 0 for boolean false and 1 for boolean true.

preflabel: using P or N binary classification
definition: The value of a boolean data type is represented using N for boolean false (eg absence) and P for boolean true (eg presence).

preflabel: computation using the Blackburn-Caperon model
definition: The value is derived using the isotope dilution technique and equations first described in Blackburn 1979 and in Caperon et al 1979.

preflabel: calibration to read zero in clear water with computation from volume scatter
definition: A correction has been made to the data for light source deterioration due to volume of a medium using a procedure that results in a zero value in pure water, rather than a zero value in air (which would give a value in pure water of around 0.36).

preflabel: transformation from OSGB36 easting
definition: A geometric transformation has been applied to convert positions from Ordnance Survey Great Britain 1936 easting reading.

preflabel: transformation from OSGB36 northing
definition: A geometric transformation has been applied to convert positions from Ordnance Survey Great Britain 1936 northing reading.

preflabel: classification according to Rowles et al (2001)
definition: The classification used is published in Rowles, T.K., Van Dolah, F.M.,  Hohn, A.A. (2001) Gross necropsy and specimen collection protocols. In T.K. Rowles, F.M. Van Dolah and A.A. Hohn (Eds), CRC handbook of marine mammal medicine (pp. 449-470). Boca Raton, U.S.A.: CRC Press.

preflabel: computation from ash-free dry weight and temperature using a general allometric equation (Edgar, 1991)
definition: The property was derived from measurements of ash-free dry weight and temperature according to Edgar (1991).

preflabel: computation from the wave velocity cell recorded burst
definition: The quantity was derived from the mean velocities (from the East and North components) that are measured in the wave velocity cell of an acoustic wave array.

preflabel: correction for divinyl chlorophyll forms
definition: The pigment concentration has been calculated by removing the influence of divinyl chlorophyll forms.

preflabel: correction for bacteriochlorophyll c+d following Caraco and Puccoon 1986, and Golterman et al. 1978
definition: The pigment concentration has been calculated by removing the influence bacteriochlorophylls c and d.

preflabel: derivation from GEBCO_19 15 arc-second global grid
definition: The data have been derived from the GEBCO 2019 15 arc-second global bathymetric grid.

preflabel: derivation from GEBCO_14 30 arc-second global grid
definition: The data have been derived from the GEBCO 2014 30 arc-second global bathymetric grid.

preflabel: derivation from GEBCO_08 30 arc-second global grid
definition: The data have been derived from the GEBCO 2008 30 arc-second global bathymetric grid.

preflabel: differencing results from two size-fractions
definition: The data was not measured directly but derived by subtracting results from two different size-fractions: one that contains the fraction of interest and the other that does not contain the fraction of interest.

preflabel: classification using GEBCO Grid Source Data Type Identifier (SDN:GGT::)
definition: The data or information was distributed into classes defined in the controlled vocabulary collection vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/GGT/.

preflabel: classification to a term from the JNCC's Marine Habitat Classification for Britain and Ireland Version 97.06 (SDN:M24::)
definition: A text term plus URI describing the seabed habitat of marine, coastal or estuarine waters using the JNCC's Marine Habitat Classification for Britain and Ireland Version 97.06.

preflabel: conversion to WMO code using table 4300
definition: Classification into classes with standardised boundaries specified in World Meteorological Organisation published table 4300.

preflabel: processing in near real-time
definition: The data have been transformed using only fully automated data processing techniques and within the constraints of a near-real time data system with respect to transmission volume and processing power.

preflabel: classification to a term from the EMODnet Human Activities vocabulary (SDN:HA2::)
definition: The data or information was reported using terms defined in the EMODnet Human Activities vocabulary vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/HA2.

preflabel: classification to a term from the Marine Strategy Framework Directive broad habitat types (Commission Decision (EU)2017/848)
definition: The data or information was reported using terms defined in the Broad habitat types vocabulary http://dd.eionet.europa.eu/vocabulary/msfd/broadHabitatTypes/ released 24 Oct 2017 14:47:22.

preflabel: computation using resultant velocity components from beams 1 and 3
definition: The 3D velocity is computed from the resultant horizontal velocity components and one vertical velocity from beams 1 and 3 of an acoustic doppler current profiler.

preflabel: computation using resultant velocity components from beams 2 and 4
definition: The 3D velocity is computed from the resultant horizontal velocity components and one vertical velocity from beams 2 and 4 of an acoustic doppler current profiler.

preflabel: computation using the eddy covariance method
definition: A statistical method used to process eddy covariance measurements and to derive quantities such as heat, momentum, and gas fluxes between a flat, horizontally homogeneous surface and the overlying atmosphere.

preflabel: computation of carbon biomass using the equation of Alcaraz et al. (2003)
definition: Carbon biomass derived from image analysis using methodology described in Alcaraz, M., Saiz, E., Calbet, A. et al. Estimating zooplankton biomass through image analysis. Marine Biology 143, 307–315 (2003). https://doi.org/10.1007/s00227-003-1094-8.

preflabel: computation of carbon biomass from abundance using the equations of Menden-Deuer and Lessard (2000)
definition: Carbon biomass derived from abundance using methodology described in Menden-Deuer and Lessard (2000). Carbon to volume relationships for dino?agellates, diatoms, and other protist plankton (https://doi.org/10.4319/lo.2000.45.3.0569).

preflabel: computation of carbon biomass using the equation of Andrássy (1956)
definition: Carbon biomass derived from image analysis using the Andrássy (1956) formula for nematodes: W = (L*D2)/(1.6*106) where W is the mass (as fresh weight in ug) per individual, L is the nematode length (um) and D is the greatest body diameter (um).

preflabel: computation of carbon biomass from displacement volumes
definition: Carbon biomass estimated from displacement volumes using unknown algorithms or algorithms specified elsewhere in the metadata.

preflabel: computation from true wind speed using the COARE3.5 model (Edson et al. 2013)
definition: True wind speed is computed to neutral conditionas using the COARE3.5 model algorithm (Edson et al. 2013, https://doi.org/10.1175/JPO-D-12-0173.1).

preflabel: classification to a term from the OSPAR Commission's List of Threatened and/or Declining Species and Habitats (SDN:M22::)
definition: The habitat has been described using a term defined in the OSPAR Commission's List of Threatened and/or Declining Species and Habitats (SDN:M22::).

preflabel: classification to a term from the HELCOM 'HUB' Underwater Biotope and Habitat Classification System (SDN:M23::)
definition: The habitat has been described using a term defined in the HELCOM 'HUB' Underwater Biotope and Habitat Classification System (SDN:M23::).

preflabel: classification to a term from the Everyone's Gliding Observatories (EGO) format reference list (https://doi.org/10.13155/34980)
definition: The classification used is published as a reference table within the Everyone's Gliding Observatories (EGO) gliders NetCDF format reference manual, with the latest version published at https://doi.org/10.13155/34980.

preflabel: normalisation at zero pressure and 25 degrees Celsius
definition: The data presented are normalised to account for the effect of temperature and pressure on the neutral value of pH.

preflabel: manufacturer's calibration and correction against independent temperature and salinity measurements
definition: The sensor has been calibrated using the manufacturer's calibration, and has been further corrected against other measurements of the observed property (e.g. from another sensor). The latter may be applied using dedicated software (e.g. Sea-Bird software).

preflabel: manufacturer's calibration and laboratory calibration against TRIS-buffer applied
definition: The sensor has been calibrated using the manufacturer's calibration, and has been further calibrated against a TRIS-buffer with salinity 35. This involves immersing the sensor electrodes in a certified reference material (CRM) and comparing the sensor output values with the theoretical values for the TRIS buffer at different temperatures. The offset is then applied to the sensor values.

preflabel: computation using equations from Legendre and Gosseline (1996)
definition: The parameter has been calculated using the equations published in Legendre, L., and Gosseline, M. (1996). Estimation of N and C uptake rates by phytoplankton using 15N and 13C: revisiting the usual computation formulae. J. Plankt. Res. 19, 263-271.
